assessment.title: Endocrine Homeostasis and Integration of Systems

body.p: Which of the following is not a mechanism used by aldosterone to increase blood pressure?

input.choice: Prevents loss of sodium from sweat
Increases the osmotic absorption of water

feedback.p: Incorrect. Aldosterone maintains proper water balance by enhancing the sodium reabsorption.
Incorrect. To increase the amount of sodium in the body aldosterone prevents the secretion of sodium in the sweat.
Correct. ADH maintains water balance by promoting the reabsorption of water.
Incorrect. By increasing the reabsorption of sodium the water follows because of osmosis.

body.p: Which of the following hormones are called gonadotropins?

feedback.p: Incorrect. GnRH stimulates the release of the gonadotropins.
Correct. FSH and LH both stimulate the gonads and so are called gonadotropins.

body.p: Which of the following is not matched with its function?

input.choice: Androgen binding protein keeps plasma levels of testosterone higher in the testes than in the other body fluids.
LH stimulates the production of androgens.
Testosterone promotes production of sex hormones.

feedback.p: Correct. Androgen binding protein keeps the level of testosterone high in the testes to help sperm maturation.
Incorrect. The function of inhibin is to inhibit the release of FSH from the anterior pituitary gland.
Incorrect. LH also called interstial cell-stimulating hormone stimulates the production of androgens from the interstitial cells.
Correct, this is matched incorrectly. Testosterone is an androgen that promotes the production and maturation of sperm, not sex hormones.

body.p: A surge of which hormone stimulates ovulation?

feedback.p: Incorrect. FSH stimulates the development of support cells.
Correct. A surge of LH from the anterior pituitary stimulates ovulation.
Incorrect. Estrogen levels will rise and stimulate the surge of LH.
Incorrect. Progesterone helps regulate the menstrual cycle.

body.p: The release of oxytocin can be stimulated by:

input.choice: Release of FSH from the anterior pituitary
Release of prolactin from the anterior pituitary

feedback.p: Incorrect. Oxytocin is present in higher amounts near the end of pregnancy not near the beginning.
Correct. The suckling of an infant can cause a positive feedback loop that stimulates oxytocin production.
Incorrect. The release of FSH stimulates follicle development.
Incorrect. Prolactin is involved in the production of milk but does not stimulate oxytocin release.

body.p: Insulin lowers the blood glucose level by:

input.choice: Increasing the amount of glucose transporters in target cells.
Increasing the conversion of glucose to glycogen.
Stimulates the conversion of glucose to fat

feedback.p: Incorrect. This is only one of the ways that insulin lowers the blood glucose level.
Incorrect. This is only one of the ways that insulin lowers the blood glucose level.
Incorrect. This is only one of the ways that insulin lowers the blood glucose level.
Correct. All of these are ways that insulin lowers the blood glucose levels.

body.p: Which of the following diseases is described accurately?

input.choice: Graves' diseases is a condition where too little thyroid hormone is produced.
Graves’ disease is an example of a hyperthyroid condition.
Graves’ disease can lead to an increased heart rate.
All of these describe Graves’ disease accurately.

feedback.p: Incorrect. Graves’ disease is a condition where too much thyroid hormone is produced.
Correct. Graves’ disease is a condition where too much thyroid hormone is produced which is hyperthyroidism.
Incorrect. Graves’ disease is a hyperthyroidism which increases the metabolic rate and increase the heart rate.
Incorrect. Think carefully about the prefixes hypo- and hyper-.

body.p: The role of calcitonin in lowering blood calcium levels is not well understood in?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Infants fall into the category of children and calcitonin plays a major role in maintaining proper blood calcium levels.
Incorrect. Calcitonin plays a major role in maintaining proper blood calcium levels in children.
Incorrect. Calcitonin plays a major role in maintaining proper blood calcium levels in preventing bone loss in pregnant women.
Correct. The role of calcitonin in blood calcium levels is not well understood in adults.

body.p: Which hormone would be involved in the fight or flight response?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Cortisol is produced in response to long term stress not to short term stress that would cause the fight-or-flight response.
Incorrect. Aldosterone is produced in response to long term stress not to short term stress that would cause the fight-or-flight response.
Correct. Another name for epinephrine is adrenaline which is stimulated by the sympathetic nervous system in response to short term stress.
Incorrect. ACTH is produced in response to long term stress not to short term stress that would cause the fight-or-flight response.

body.p: Hypersecretion of glucocorticoids can cause a condition known as:

feedback.p: Incorrect. A goiter is the result of hypothyroidism.
Incorrect. Graves’ disease is a result of hypothyroidism.
Incorrect. Addison’s Disease is a result of hyposecretion of corticosteroids.
Correct. Cushing’s disease is a result of hypersecretion of corticosteroids.
